decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">SOFT LANDSCAPING AND
RETENTION OF TREES<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">&nbsp;</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">Prior to
commencement to submit a revised landscape plan showing no increase in
hardstanding and no removal of trees to the front have been submitted to, and
agreed in writing by, the local planning authority. Soft landscaping works
shall include: planting plans (at a scale not less than 1:100), written
specification of planting and cultivation works to be undertaken and schedules
of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers / densities and an
implementation programme. Tree planting along the boundaries adjacent to the
car park and screening around carparking area with hedge planting. The hard
surfacing details shall include details of all boundary treatment, details to
show the texture and colour of the materials to be used and information about
their sourcing/manufacturer. The development shall be carried out in accordance
with the scheme so agreed and shall be retained as such thereafter. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

2313-PL-050-P1 Brookesfield Prop Site Plan

2313-PL-055-P1 Brookesfield Prop Ground floor Plan 2313-PL-056-P1 Brookesfield Prop First floor Plan

2313-PL-057-P1 Brookesfield Prop Second floor Plan 2313-PL-058-P1 Brookesfield Prop Roof Plan

2313-PL-060-P1 Brookesfield Prop Elevs 1

2313-PL-061-P1 Brookesfield Prop Elevs 2

2313-PL-070-P1 Brookesfield Prop Sects 2313 Brookesfield - Heritage Statement

2313-PL-050-P1 Brookesfield Prop Site Plan

Brookesfield - AIA - May 2024

V2 TREE REPORT (AIA) - Brookesfield

Notwithstanding the submitted details and approved plans, the development hereby permitted shall not shall not progress beyond damp proof course level , until details of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces noted below have been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority: - the extensions including windows, doors, balustrade and roofing materials; - the ground surfacing; including all hard standing The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall thereafter be retained.

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">TREE PLANTING <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">&nbsp;</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">Prior to completion
or first occupation of the development hereby approved, whichever is the
sooner; full details of all proposed tree planting (replacement trees on a 2:1
basis) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority. This will include planting and maintenance specifications, including
cross-section drawings, use of guards or other protective measures and
confirmation of location, species and sizes, nursery stock type, supplier and
defect period. All tree planting shall be carried out in accordance with those
details and at those times. Any trees that are found to be dead, dying,
severely damaged or diseased within five years of the completion of the
building works OR five years of the carrying out of the landscaping scheme
(whichever is later), shall be replaced in the next planting season by
specimens of similar size and species in the first suitable planting season. <o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none">&nbsp;</p><p><br></p>
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no window(s)/door(s) shall be installed in the  flank elevation(s) of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
description: Single and two storey side extension; single storey rear extension; single storey side extension (to other side); front porch; three rear dormers; raised patio at rear; Balcony to the first floor rear, external alterations (demolition of side extension, car port, rear conservatory, chimney and front porch) (AMENDED DESCRIPTION)
